headline: Salesforce (CRM): Rethinking Valuation After a Sharp Short-Term Share Price Rebound
summary: Salesforce (CRM) has quietly bounced, with shares up about 5% in the past day and roughly 13% over the week, even though its year to date performance still trails the broader tech sector. See our latest analysis for Salesforce. Put in context, that 5.3% 1 day and 13.0% 7 day share price return looks more like a sharp relief rally than a trend change. The share price is still down year to date, while the 3 year total shareholder return remains very strong. If this move in Salesforce has you...

headline: Salesforce Is One of the Dogs of the Dow. Should You Buy the Dip in CRM Stock Now?
summary: With Salesforce sinking while the Dow climbs this year, is CRM stock a rare blue-chip bargain or a trap in disguise?

headline: Why the timing was right for Salesforce’s $8 billion acquisition of Informatica — and for the opportunities ahead
summary: It’s wrong to think of an acquisition as an end game. It’s a new chapter.

headline: How Recent Shifts in AI and Competition Are Rewriting the Story for Salesforce
summary: Salesforce’s fair value estimate has been trimmed slightly from about $331 to roughly $327 per share, reflecting a modest reset in expectations as the market reassesses its long term growth path. While the discount rate has ticked up from around 8.54% to roughly 8.60%, long term revenue growth assumptions have also edged higher from about 9.47% to approximately 9.65% as investors weigh both rising competition and expanding AI driven demand. Stay tuned to see how you can track these evolving...
